original_title: Senegal’s ‘schools for husbands’ aim to keep mothers from dying | CNN
article_summary: Imam Ibrahima Diane, in a UN-backed initiative, advocates for men's involvement in household chores and gender-related issues in Senegal, promoting positive masculinity and combating gender-based violence and harmful practices like female genital mutilation. The program, which has trained over 300 men, has led to changes in attitudes towards maternal health and family planning, reducing forced marriages and increasing acceptance of gender equality in some communities.</s>
